ticket.title: RFC-0032 AT-0: ledger unification acceptance test (legacy DB -> canonical append)

in_scope: Add a system-level test that seeds a DB containing only legacy `ledger_events` rows and verifies daemon can migrate + append canonical events
Verify post-migration invariants: `events` hash chain is non-NULL and monotone, legacy table name is absent/frozen, daemon append path works
out_of_scope: Testing later-phase FAC behaviors (handled by AT-1..AT-5 tickets)

steps: Add a test harness helper to create a temp SQLite DB with a minimal `ledger_events` table + a few rows
Start daemon against this DB (or call migration directly, depending on harness) and assert migration ran
Append a new event via the daemon operator protocol and assert it lands in `events` with correct prev_hash linkage

criteria: AT-0 runs in CI and locally without external dependencies.
AT-0 fails if `determine_read_mode` returns legacy mode after migration.
AT-0 fails if any migrated row has NULL `event_hash` or if chain discontinuity is detected.

notes.verification: Add debug printing of the first/last seq_id + hashes on failure to make diagnosing CI failures practical.
